intro: Pentacalia polyphlebia, commonly known as the Florida bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the spring and summer months. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
